alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Coweta; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Spalding, Fayette, east central Coweta and southwestern Clayton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Fayetteville, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Riverdale, Tyrone, Senoia, Brooks, Woolsey, Starrs Mill, Sandy Creek, Lake Horton, Inman and Birdie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
